etymology.description: semantic 阜 + phonetic 侌 (yīn); simplified from 陰 by replacing 侌 with 月.
etymology.interpretation: 阝 (from 阜) points to slopes/embankments, evoking the shaded side of a hill and by extension darkness, overcast weather, or concealment. 侌 originally provided the sound yīn and a notion of covering; after simplification to 月, the semantic idea persisted while the original phonetic cue was largely lost.
etymology.simplification: Adopted in 1956 by replacing the phonetic 侌 with the simpler and common component 月, reducing strokes and following an attested popular variant; 阝 preserves the semantic link to 阜.

examples.chinese: 今天阴天，气温下降了(今天陰天，氣溫下降了)。
examples.english: It’s overcast today, and the temperature has dropped.

examples.chinese: 我们坐在树下的阴影里休息(我們坐在樹下的陰影裡休息)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zuò zài shù xià de yīnyǐng lǐ xiūxi.
examples.english: We rested in the shade under the tree.

examples.chinese: 中医讲求阴阳平衡(中醫講求陰陽平衡)。
examples.english: Traditional Chinese medicine emphasizes the balance of yin and yang.
